title: Yama (Buddhism)
summary: In East Asian and Buddhist mythology, Yama (sometimes known as the King of Hell, King Yan (Yam) or Yanluo (Yamla) ) is a dharmapala (wrathful god) said to judge the dead and preside over the Narakas ("Hells", "Hell Realm" or "Purgatories") and the cycle of afterlife saṃsāra.
